column1: player_mission_unify_title_tooltip0:"Start ambition for holding all lands within the [GetPlayer.GetPrimaryTitle.GetDeJureLiege.GetName]"
player_mission.0001.desc0:"It seems the world has changed not necessarily to my advantage. How will the world see me if I walk away from my ambitions now?."
player_mission.0001.a0:"As a coward. Let us press on!"
player_mission.0001.b0:"As wise and caring. Let us reconsider."
player_mission.1001.desc0:"I am the rightful ruler of [GetPlayer.GetPrimaryTitle.GetName]
column2: yet there are those who oppose my leadership. For the good of the realm
column3: all lawful subjects should be under the same banner."

column1: player_mission.1002.desc0:"My lands are united and any rebellious fires have been temporarily quelled. Future rebel rousers or pretenders would do well in not crossing me!"
player_mission.1002.a0:"No one shall threaten the stability of my realm."

column2: a single hooded figure stands at the foot of my bed. If he is death
column3: then I am not ready to go! I still have dreams to pursue!"

column1: player_mission.1011.b0:"Calm now. I have plenty of time left."

column2: I have now earned a place in history. Songs and stories will be told of me long after I depart!"
I can rest."

column1: player_mission.1012.b0:"Do I have time to do more?"
player_mission.1021.desc0:"Long have I coveted the crown of the [GetPlayer.GetPrimaryTitle.GetDeJureLiege.GetName] and know that it can be within my reach. A few well played moves
column2: and can make it so. My desire must not make me careless
column3: as a wrong move may ruin me."

column2: though it may not be over. Many are those who look to my crown as a price to take. They will watch my every move and strike whenever I falter."

column1: player_mission.1022.b0:"It would be foolish to stop now!"
player_mission.1031.desc0:"Some say the weight of a crown is heavy to bear. They must have weak necks! Indeed
column2: my own neck would be more than able to bear the crown of the [GetPlayer.GetPrimaryTitle.GetDeJureLiege.GetName]."

column1: player_mission.1031.a0:"I wish to try it on."
player_mission.1031.b0:"The one I have already is enough."
player_mission.1032.desc0:"No matter how ornate or encrusted the crown
column2: my neck can bear it and still hold my head up high! I feel elevated even
column3: towering above my peers. The insides are rather pointed though."

column1: player_mission.1032.a0:"Perhaps I can have it cushioned?"

column2: Content

column1: player_mission.1041.desc0:"Our world is harsh and full of perils
column2: yet I am tasked with protecting my family and kin. If I were to join the most dangerous game and claim great riches and wealth
column3: could it then not be spent on our defenses?"

column1: player_mission.1041.a0:"I have to do it for them!"
player_mission.1042.desc0:"No man has ever claimed success without creating envy. With our new position
column2: my family have the resources to prosper
column3: but also new enemies to fear!"

column2: and I fear that I must be their shepherd. For I am the drum on which the heavens beat their holy song. Many are the men in power who will stand against me
column3: but I have no choice. I would gladly sacrifice my body to cast down the wicked and bring salvation to the good!"

column2: but my fate!"

column1: player_mission.1051.b0:"A warrior must not only be brave
column2: but patient."

column1: player_mission.1052.desc0:"Heaven's will has been done! Have I now found my place
column2: or is my task greater still?"
I shall not risk to err."

column1: player_mission.1052.b0:"My work only ceases with me."
player_mission.1061.desc0:"The green lands of Englands have spoiled it's peoples. The anglo-saxons sleep in soft beds and cower behind stone walls. As we prepare our longships and sharpen our axes
column2: they dine in their castles and worry not to muddy their boots. What you can not defend

column1: player_mission.1061.a0:"They have lost the right to their lands."
player_mission.1062.desc0:"I merely proved my right to rule
column2: yet in my wake
column3: I have left a trail of destruction and misery. The once green and fruitful lands are running red with blood. The villages I am to rule have been starved and burned."

column1: player_mission.1062.a0:"I refuse to grow soft. A conqueror conquerors."
player_mission.1071.desc0:"Why are my neighbouring rulers in such a disarray and malcontent? So many of them fail to see their way out of darkness
column2: instead focusing on petty squabbles. They all either lack vision
column4: morals or funds. If a handful could be persuaded to join my cause
column5: to see what future I can see
column6: then the rest would follow. Once united

column2: I just have to make it so."
lest they unite against me."

column1: player_mission.1072.desc0:"The peninsula is once again ruled by a single crown
column2: yet I must not be fooled to think it is the only crown still with power. Those who previously fought over scraps have now a common prey to fell."

column1: player_mission.1072.a0:"At least my herd is great and strong."
player_mission.1081.desc0:"Rome lost its status as crown jewel of the Mediterranean long before the fall of the west
column2: yet it's symbolic meaning never waned. The decision to retake the old capital should not be taken lightly
column3: yet one can not restore the old order without it. If I am to undo centuries of chaos and decline
column4: then this path is one I must eventually walk."

column1: player_mission.1081.b0:"I must not gamble away an empire."

column2: there is cause for a true triumph! Our troops have cast out the squatters of the holy city and are now distributing bread and restoring order. Is this a turning point for civilization
column3: or will it be a mere footnote in the history books?"

column1: player_mission.1082.a0:"I will not lose the city again."
player_mission.1091.desc0:"I can no longer sit idly by as the [ROOT.Char.GetFaith.HouseOfWorshipPlural] in [holy_site_1.GetNameNoTierNoTooltip] gets defaced by heretics! Come morning
column2: I shall gather my most learned men and pious warriors to find a way for it's salvation!"

column1: player_mission.1091.b0:"The road is long. We must prepare properly."
player_mission.1092.desc0:"I stand in awe at the realization
column2: the [ROOT.Char.GetFaith.HouseOfWorship] has been saved! A tear falls down my cheek as I lift my head towards a blue sky. From this day onwards
column3: few men can deny the power of [ROOT.Char.GetFaith]!"

column1: player_mission.1092.a0:"I have been blessed to be here."

player_mission.1101.desc0:"The road is slippery with mud and wet stone as I trudge my way up from the market. The cold rain is pouring down and finds it's way inside my sweaty tunic. Curse this depressing place! Somewhere in the back of my mind
column2: echoes of far away shores appear. Images of white beaches
column3: fruit trees and exotic beasts fill my head. If paradise worlds such as those do exist
column4: then what am I doing in this bitter place?"

column1: player_mission.1101.a0:"It is high time I went on an adventure!"
player_mission.1101.b0:"I need to know more of my destination before I leave!"
player_mission.1102.desc0:"This truly is a paradise! It is everything I hoped for
column2: but not without its dangers. To keep my spot in this paradise
column3: I must either get along with the locals

column1: player_mission.1102.a0:"I am exposed as it is
column2: I must make friends."

column1: player_mission.1102.b0:"It is too late to play nice now!"
player_mission.1111.desc0:"Our ancestral lands have long been the battleground where foreign cultures wrestle for control. Yet
column2: there is a changing of the winds. Could we live in the age when the invaders are finally dispelled and the natural order is restored?"

column1: player_mission.1111.b0:"I should strike when they least suspect."

column2: theatre groups are dramatizing the stories of Finn and the Fianna and the Dlí na Feíne can once again be followed without outside opposition. United and unshackled
column3: we must never allow invaders to land on our shores again."

column1: player_mission.1112.a0:"The age of the celts has come!"
player_mission.1121.desc0:"The once great empire of the Carolingians has been shattered by infighting
column2: inheritance and invaders. It would require the strength matching that of Charlemagne himself to bring the empire back together. Do I dare to assume I have such strength within me?"

column1: player_mission.1121.b0:"True strength lies in picking your battles."
player_mission.1122.desc0:"I know my forefathers would look proudly upon me today. For I have mended the empire that lesser men broke. I must reforge it stronger than before
column2: lest it will break again."

column1: player_mission.1122.a0:"It will take more than a sharp sword to hold our empire together."
game_concept_increasing_army_size_desc0:"If you have fewer soldiers than your enemy consider one of three options:\n$BULLET_WITH_TAB$[Concept('creating_men_at_arms'
column2: 'Create Men-at-arms')|E]\n$BULLET_WITH_TAB$[Concept('making_alliances'

column1: game_concept_creating_men_at_arms_desc0:"You can create [regiments|E] of well trained men to strengthen your [army|E]. Go to the military window (press F2) and select [men_at_arms|E] type there."

game_concept_making_alliances_desc0:"Other [rulers|E] who have family bonds with you can participate in your [wars|E] on your side. To make someone become your [ally|E] just [marry|E] one of your children to theirs and then invite them to the war once it’s started."
game_concept_hiring_mercenaries_desc0:"[mercenaries|E] are a costly but efficient way of quickly increasing your [army|E] size. If you want to hire some
column2: go to your armies menu (press F2) and select a mercenary band from the mercenaries tab."

column1: TASK_ICON_NOT_YET_CREATED0:"#N Title is not yet created#!"
TASK_ICON_AT_WAR_OVER_TITLE0:"#N We are at war for this $TITLE|l$#!"

column1: TASK_ICON_ALLIES_TOOLTIP_INFO0:"Allies are not required to join your wars.\n\n"

column2: 'Become $TARGETTITLETIER$'
